'Zhejiang University' ('ZJU', also known as 'Chekiang University'; ), sometimes
referred to as 'Zheda', is a national university in China. Founded in 1897,
Zhejiang University is one of China's oldest institutions of higher education.
It is a member of the C9 League and Yangtze Delta Universities Alliance.

Zhejiang University is located in the city of Hangzhou, Zhejiang Province,
approximately 112 miles (180 km) southwest of Shanghai. Zhejiang University
Library collection contains about 7  million
volumes, [http://daxue.learning.sohu.com/school_detail_4.html æçç½ â é«æ ¡é¨æ·ç½ â
æµæ±å¤§å­¦] making it one of the largest academic libraries in the
country. Libraries in China
